page.title: 16Biography (cont)....
page.content: Lessons were maths, handwriting, history, geography, nature and scripture. School could be started at 3 years old and pupils left at 14. Discipline was strict and the cane was used for punishment. For medical treatment people often had their own medicines and cures which were kept in their own homes. The disease that people dreaded most was Tuberculosis as this could not be cured. People remember epidemics of whooping cough and scarlet fever. There was a local Fever Hospital at Garforth Cliff. Medicine and treatment was not free and there were a few tablets. Medicine was 6d per bottle. For leisure people often went to the cinema. Films were 2 or 3 years old by the time Kippax cinema showed them. Entrance fee was 1d for the morning and 3d in the evening.
